summary: This bill, the Justice Thurgood Marshall National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2025, proposes to establish the Justice Thurgood Marshall National Historic Site in Baltimore, Maryland. The site will encompass the former Public School 103, where Marshall received his elementary education. The bill aims to preserve and interpret Marshall's contributions to civil rights. The Beloved Community Services Corporation will continue to own and manage the site, with the Secretary of the Interior providing technical assistance and entering into cooperative agreements for preservation and interpretation. The bill does not authorize acquisition of the property or ongoing financial responsibility by the Secretary.
